[url=http://www.google.de/search?hs=UOQ&hl=de&client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla%3Ade-DE_%21--EZCODE_EMOTICON_START__%21--EZCODE_EMOTICON_START__%21--EZCODE_EMOTICON_START__%21--EZCODE_EMOTICON_START_%3Ao_--__img_src%3Dhttp%3A%2F%2Fwww.classicgaming.com%2Fcc314%2Fmsgboard%2Femotikeen-embarrassed.gif_ALT%3D&q=%22keen+forum%22+official+games&btnG=Suche&meta=]www.google.de/search?hs=UOQ&hl=de&client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla%3Ade-DE_%21--EZCODE_EMOTICON_START__%21--EZCODE_EMOTICON_START__%21--EZCODE_EMOTICON_START__%21--EZCODE_EMOTICON_START_%3Ao_--__img_src%3Dhttp%3A%2F%2Fwww.classicgaming.com%2Fcc314%2Fmsgboard%2Femotikeen-embarrassed.gif_ALT%3D&q=%22keen+forum%22+official+games&btnG=Suche&meta=[/url]

title: Good luck.
content:
I tried that option as soon as we found out we weren't getting the topics back. I searched 'Public Commander Keen Forum', since that shows up on every page at the PCKF, but the only topic that showed up was the main page, and that links directly to the board itself rather than other cached pages.

Nonetheless, if you can find anything, save the pages and upload them somewhere (or email them to me and I'll store them on Spleen Keen). No need to attempt re-merging them into the forum.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

The development of the hardware, and the greater ability to express every idea that flies into a programmers head, mean that game creators have made the new games congested with every technique in their power. The basic games behind all this are so blurred that people cant catch up. We should go back to basics like Pac-Man and play in an easier, more relaxed way. -Toru Iwatani

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: RESCUE THE LOST KEEN THREADS!
content:
I already asked Google about this a day or two after the attack - unfortunately they can't help:

"Thank you for your note. We apologize for our delayed response. Although we would like to be able to assist you in retrieving cached copies of this site, the only cached information we have available is that which can be found through our website.

It's possible that you may be able to locate additional
information by visiting [url=http://www.archive.org/web/web.php.]www.archive.org/web/web.php.[/url] This site archives past versions of webpages. Although we have no affiliation with this site, we've received reports from users that it has been helpful in these types of situations.

Regards,
The Google Team"

title: Re: !!!
content: To note, the crack happened everywhere on ezBoard system, and wasn't a specific attack against PCKF..[url=http://www.keengrid.net/]keengrid.net[/url]

title: Re: !!!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Although we would like to be able to assist you in retrieving cached copies of this site, the only cached information we have available is that which can be found through our website. [hr][/quote]

Well, if I search a specific domain for a word, for instance: "site:www.3drealms.com keen", I get a number of hits.
Right below the link, there is the sentence which includes the word, but sometimes if the word is found multiple times and/or other words you entered are found, you get sentence-fragments joined by elipses.
This indicates it's not just the first 2 lines Google can show, meaning the entire document is cached.
After all, if it only had a few lines cached, how would Google be able to properly do a search?

I suppose theoretically you could type in another word of the sentence you get, and hop along a word everytime, so you reach every sentence, and with a million times copying and pasting you could reconstruct the entire document, but...
So if you ask me Google does in fact have more cached information available than what is humanly available through their site.
Like I said, their policy probably restricts them from just handing it out.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Cache...
content:
[hr]Ret I suppose theoretically you could type in another word of the sentence you get, and hop along a word everytime, so you reach every sentence, and with a million times copying and pasting you could reconstruct the entire document, but...
[hr]Or just click the 'Cached' link that follows the result... that's what it's there for. The problem is they don't seem to cache many actual posts. Occasionally they'll show up, but I haven't noticed any sort of pattern.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

title: Re: Ahh...
content:
Horrow! I was hoping that someone will restore all old topics in this forum and it's probably possible now!
More detais: the unneeded deleting of topics have started much ealier than May 31, 2005! After the 20th page was filled the forum started deleting of most old topics (in the down of 20-th page). I have noticed it in June 2004. It seems that number or pages is limited to 20.
We have totally more than 20 pages of losed topics. So you can't save all those threads on this forum. For this purpose, make please new site for which doesn't erase any information automatically.
Anyway, i want to have old threads again.
I wish you lucky restoration process.
[img]http://classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/images/enemyk4-wormouth.gif[/img]

title: Re: fwe
content:
I now found the other way to restore threads: use the saved ones. Yesterday i have reviewed all my saved files and found approximaly 50-55 threads from the forum "Official Keen Games"! Total number of disappeared threads in that forum is approximaly 820, so i made approximaly 1/16<sup>th</sup> of the work. Other forums weren't "restored", because i practically don't have saved threads from them.
People! Please help me, if you can. Find any threads from this forum on your computer, pack them into ZIP or RAR archive (without the folders, which contains images from page: <Filename>_Files, where <Filename> is a name of page without extnension (.htm or .html)) and send them to me. My e-mail is: drm1991@mail.ru. MHT files also fits for me.

If you used the default filenames, you can easily find them. Open the standard searching utilite ("Start - Search - Files or folders"), and input the filename "*ezboard*". Unfortanutely, it doesn't work, if you used the Internet explorer 4.0 or older, because in these browsers you have to input your filename during each save.

If you can, you may also:
Select the best (slowest) compression ratio in the archiver. I have slow internet, so it's very actual. Size of mailbox is also not infinite.
Pack also the images that were posted (i.e presents in posts)
Split your archives into a volumes not more than 1 Megabyte. This function is also available in a archiver (WinZip or WinRar).

Thank you very much for any help. If you send me saved threads i'll be able to restore this forum and send the result to someone, who can upload it! So yo'll help many people, who want to see old threads again, not just me.
[img]http://classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/images/enemyk4-wormouth.gif[/img]
